intro: Persoonia marginata var. ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf mistletoe, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of southern Australia, where it typically grows on the branches of eucalyptus trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, oval-shaped leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. It produces small, red, fleshy fruits that are adapted for dispersal by birds. This variety is often distinguished from other Persoonia species by its unique leaf shape and growth habit.
